Marina.Action: Sings with grace and talent, shows magnetic presence on stage.
Laughs and blows out birthday candle, expresses sincere thanks to Orlando and waiters.
Hugs and kisses Orlando warmly after receiving a thoughtful gift.
Sings a salsa song with grace and talent on stage.
Interacts politely and appreciatively with waiters and Orlando, showing social ease and confidence.
Receives and opens a formal gift (airline tickets), responds with enthusiasm and curiosity.
Questions the wording of the gift (valid for two tickets), indicating awareness and critical thinking.
Laughs and kisses Orlando playfully despite his forgetfulness.
Turns on the light and immediately attends to Orlando when he has trouble breathing, showing concern and urgency.
Runs to catch Orlando when he falls and helps him sit on the bed, showing care and attentiveness.
Carries Orlando outside and supports him, providing physical and emotional support.

Searches for Orlando’s keys, runs back to the apartment to get them, calls Orlando tenderly as he falls down stairs, tries to help him up, drives him urgently to hospital, pleads with him to talk, seeks help from paramedics.
Urgently instructs paramedics to be careful with Orlando while he is being extracted from the car.
Provides paramedics with patient information calmly and cooperatively despite the stressful situation.
Follows medical staff into the reanimation cubicle impulsively, possibly out of concern and anxiety.
Remains motionless and disoriented while observing medical staff work, showing vulnerability but no interference.
Tells paramedics relevant information clearly and promptly (name, no medication, age, recent symptoms).
Follows emergency personnel impulsively into the reanimation cubicle and remains motionless, disoriented, despite being asked to wait outside.
Waits patiently and calmly for news about Orlando, despite being in shock and alone.
Tells the nurse they are friends and the doctor they are partners, showing honesty and openness.
Draws closer to the doctor, showing vulnerability and trust despite the tense situation.
Remains silent and withdrawn when alone, showing emotional pain but not lashing out or being hostile.
Maintains composure and calmly answers the nurse's questions about Orlando despite the tense situation.
Affirms partnership with Orlando confidently when questioned by the doctor, demonstrating clarity and assertiveness.
Waits quietly and passively without further questioning or taking initiative while paramedics and hospital staff handle the situation.
Leaves the doctor’s private questioning seemingly in shock and collapses in the bathroom, showing emotional overwhelm despite the earlier composure.
Calls Gabo to inform him of Orlando's sudden illness and death, expresses apology and nervousness.
Admits needing help and asks for someone to come to the hospital.
Ends call and quietly leaves the hospital, avoiding further confrontation or emotional involvement.
Confronts the doctor about being treated like a criminal.
Maintains composure and responds seriously to the chief police officer's questioning.
Responds nervously and remorsefully to Gabo’s greeting.
After initial hesitation, calmly produces her ID card when demanded despite bureaucratic friction.
Challenges the police officer with controlled, serious expressions, asking pertinent questions about her situation and the handling of her ID card.
Initially reluctant and confused about the procedures, indicating some discomfort and lack of proactive understanding of the situation.
Maintains composure and professionalism under pressure from the authorities.
Dictates her phone number to the police officer despite feeling humiliated.
Greets people politely and offers to get water to a client promptly.
Attempts to appear normal and function well while serving customers.
Dictates her phone number to the police officer despite feeling humiliated.
Drives Orlando’s car nervously at considerable speed.
Performs strong final punch on punching game, showing physical capability and focus.
Tries to function normally while attending customers and carrying trays.
Responds promptly and politely to customer requests.
Seems reluctant to take the night shift when asked by her boss.
Comes to work despite a difficult celebration, shows responsibility and consideration.
Politely interacts with Sonia, agrees to help with car and apartment matters despite tension.
Pretends everything is fine when answering the phone, conceals true feelings.
Takes the phone quickly, excuses herself discreetly to answer privately despite a busy work environment.
Engages calmly and clearly with Sonia, negotiating car drop-off and maintaining control over the conversation.
Pretends everything is fine on the phone despite emotional tension.
Replies vaguely or minimally to Sonia about important personal matters like the apartment.
Shakes hands politely with Detective Adriana and speaks calmly despite discomfort.
Offers condolences and responds to accusations sincerely without hostility.
Maintains composure and requests proper identification from detective, showing respect for procedure.
Feels irritated and becomes defensive when her relationship is questioned, but responds without rudeness.
Responds briefly and formally to Sonia regarding handling practical affairs, not expressing much emotion.
Holds back information and reacts with fear when confronted about bruises, looks at the photos showing injuries then closes the file abruptly, showing emotional vulnerability.
Refuses to stay and answer more questions from Adriana, insists on returning to work despite the situation.
Clearly and calmly answers sensitive questions despite discomfort, tries to maintain control of the situation.
Holds back reacting emotionally to provocative questioning, showing some restraint.
Expresses urgency to return to work and avoid losing her job, indicating responsibility and awareness of consequences.
Seems confused and affected when confronted with evidence (photos of injuries), indicating some vulnerability and lack of preparedness.
Responds sarcastically or evasively (‘Am I being arrested?’) to deflect uncomfortable pressure, showing some social skill but also resistance.
Abruptly tries to leave the situation rather than engage further with Adriana, which may suggest avoidance rather than effective problem solving.
Nods reluctantly to Adriana's request to call her, showing a willingness to communicate despite discomfort.
Thanks Alessandra for trying to rescue her, acknowledges help politely.
Avoids discussing her problems with Alessandra by asking to talk another time, indicating emotional withdrawal.
Greets Diabla warmly upon returning home, indicating friendliness and comfort in companionship.
Tries to relax by smoking and breathing exercises, shows vulnerability and attempts self-care.
Surprised and visibly upset by Bruno’s presence but does not act aggressively toward him.
Responds calmly and straightforwardly to Bruno's questions despite tension.
Omits showing any hostility or rudeness to Bruno despite emotional distress.
Explains Bruno about the injury and moving in, engages honestly though affected.
Admits to receiving the dog Diabla from Orlando, expresses apology.
Responds upset and defended when Bruno makes insensitive or intrusive remarks.
Begging to leave the living room and avoid conflict with Bruno.
Avoids disclosing exact moving date under pressure by Bruno, but promises to inform.
States she was moving in and plans to notify Bruno as soon as she finds another place to live.
Avoids answering invasive questions about her body and identity, showing some boundary-setting but also discomfort.
Begs to leave the room when conversation becomes uncomfortable, indicating avoidance rather than confrontation or problem-solving.
Faces Bruno defiantly and asks him to leave her house, asserting boundaries firmly but without aggression.
Responds to Bruno's threat by calmly stating her name and saying goodbye, showing composure and a subtle friendly tone despite tension.
Sings quietly and finds a peaceful moment alone in the carwash, indicating a gentle, vulnerable side.
Overwhelmed and distracted at the gas station, snaps back when called but quickly agrees to buy coffee, displaying some social warmth despite personal distress.
Faces Bruno defiantly and asserts control by telling him to go away from her house, slamming the door behind him.
Fails to notice it’s her turn at the cash register because she is overwhelmed and distracted.
Greets the doorman politely and follows instructions patiently.
Responds calmly and without malice to Sonia’s stunned and somewhat cold reception.
Uses a simple gesture to acknowledge Sonia, showing openness despite tension.
Accepts Sonia’s disbelief and coldness without confrontation or defensiveness.
Navigates the busy highway confidently and interacts politely and clearly with the doorman and Sonia, handing over the car and documents without hesitation.
Does not insist or clarify when Sonia is confused or uneasy, simply responds with brief acceptance.
Responds sincerely and calmly to Sonia’s harsh words without escalating conflict.
Feels loathing and compassion at the same time, indicating emotional complexity but possible internal conflict.
Is taken aback by Sonia calling her a chimera, showing some vulnerability but remains composed.
Expresses desire to attend the wake to say goodbye and asserts her right despite opposition.
Refuses financial compensation from Sonia, showing dignity and sincerity.
Maintains calm and fearless composure despite Sonia's hostile and exclusionary attitude.
Does not retaliate or escalate conflict when Sonia forbids her from attending funeral or wake.
Apologizes sincerely to Adriana for not calling, admits to being overwhelmed and taking sleeping pills.
Shows worry and concern upon learning about toxicology results.
Persistently questions and resists the physical inspection but listens to Adriana.
Apologizes to Detective Cortes for not calling and explains with a reason, showing awareness and accountability.
Questions about seeing Orlando’s body and the procedures, showing some initiative and engagement.
Stops walking abruptly and refuses the physical inspection after hearing about it, showing resistance but potentially a lack of cooperation or understanding of official procedures.
Shows concern after hearing about toxicology results, indicating awareness but also emotional disturbance which could hinder clear thinking.
Refuses the injury observation requested by Adriana, showing assertiveness and awareness of her rights.
Stops walking and shows visible anger when Adriana insists, indicating emotional vulnerability but also strategic caution.
Does not respond when caught, indicating possible hesitation or recognition of the situation’s seriousness.
Listens carefully to the conversation between the doctor and Adriana while undressing, demonstrating alertness and situational awareness.
Complies with difficult and humiliating medical examination without protest
Says 'No' when asked about any aggression, displaying honesty
Removes hospital gown resignedly despite discomfort, without showing anger or resentment
No hostile or defensive behavior shown despite humiliation and invasive procedure
Complies with the doctor's requests calmly and without resistance despite feeling shocked and humiliated.
Does not question or challenge the invasive medical procedure even though it visibly unsettles her.
Politely declines Gabo’s offer for some ashes but speaks with sarcasm ('In exchange for not showing up, Gabo?') and hangs up the phone, ending the conversation abruptly.

Expresses gratitude clearly and politely when arriving at the elegant building and to the singing coach ('Thank you for having me. I need it.' and 'Thank you for seeing me.') despite her emotional state.
Engages in light teasing with the singing coach about his illness and his appearance, showing familiarity and a friendly, informal bond.
Plants a quick kiss on the coach's forehead as a sign of old friendship.
Interrupts the coach and points out he is not her psychologist or father, asserting boundaries.
Respectfully asks Gaston for a last favor, showing some politeness despite tension.
Insists on leaving the car to retrieve her dog alone despite others' objections, indicating determination but also disregard for others' concerns.
Runs away from the car abruptly, ignoring Gaston and Wanda calling her back.
Rides the bus indignantly, showing emotional rawness but not hostile behavior towards others.
Enters chapel at Orlando’s funeral, enduring hostile looks from others.
Asks Gaston for a favor assertively and takes the bus on her own, showing initiative and decisiveness in a difficult emotional moment.
Climbs out and runs away from the car impulsively, possibly without considering consequences.
Enters the chapel at Orlando’s funeral despite the hostile atmosphere, exhibiting courage and determination.
Affected by the girl’s sobbing, chooses not to insist and leaves the chapel quietly.
Confronts Gabo calmly and defends her right to say goodbye to a loved one.
Avoids escalating conflict when followed and harassed by the men in the pickup truck, holding back from reacting aggressively.
Crosses the chapel yard without looking back at the pain inside, seeming detached or unwilling to engage further.
Accumulates rage internally when harassed but keeps interactions controlled, not showing outward aggression.
Holds back escalating violence despite verbal abuse.
Fights back when physically attacked and restrained.
Challenges aggressors verbally and repeatedly, showing courage but also rage.
Shows concern for her dog, asking what happened to it.
Accuses aggressors of being cowards and confronts them strongly.
Appeals to aggressors’ sense of shame by referencing their father.
Holds her ground verbally despite provocations, responds assertively to insults.
Keeps walking without retaliating physically initially, showing some control over immediate reaction.
Fights back physically when grabbed and restrained.
Fails to escape or de-escalate the abduction situation; ultimately is overpowered and restrained.
Appeals to the attackers’ morality by invoking their fathers, attempting to shame them verbally.
Does not manage to avoid being silenced and restrained by tape, suggesting limited success in resisting the attackers’ control.
Struggles to free herself from attackers, shows vulnerability and pain but does not retaliate.
Engages in a drunken, intimate encounter with a stranger at the nightclub.
Walks aimlessly downtown after being abused, indicating internal suffering and lack of outward hostility.
Cuts through the tape binding her face and gets up despite pain and shame.
Walks aimlessly through downtown Santiago after being assaulted, showing disorientation.
Enters a nightclub and attempts to engage socially despite distress.
Engages in an intimate encounter with a stranger in a nightclub while emotionally and physically compromised.
Greets Gaston politely and accepts his hospitality despite looking tired and unwell.
Lies back on the sofa appearing vulnerable and unwell, showing openness to others.
Drinks coffee with family and listens to the reading of Orlando's funeral information, showing engagement in a solemn family moment.
Initiates and fully participates in a long, coordinated, vehement, and openly sexual group choreography, showing confidence and control on the dance floor.
Knocks on Wanda’s door despite being tired and physically unwell (wet), demonstrating persistence and decisiveness.
Listens attentively to the reading of Orlando's funeral information without interrupting, showing composure and focus amid emotional circumstances.
Does not respond to Gaston's attempts to divert or belittle the significance of the funeral announcement, which could be seen as either maintaining composure or passive omission.
Says 'Ok, stop it! Really, stop!' to Wanda, displays impatience and control.
Talks to herself, 'What doesn't kill you, make you stronger.' indicating self-encouragement and resilience.
Smiles at the Older Man who is struggling to find money, showing kindness and patience.
Responds directly and simply to the Older Man's charming remark without warmth or teasing, neutral interaction.
Calmly handles the situation with the Older Man by promptly handing him his check and smiling reassuringly.
Attempts to assert control by telling others to stop, but they do not pay attention to her.
Reflects quietly and shows some inner strength by repeating 'What doesn't kill you, makes you stronger.'
Is distracted and mentally disengaged, playing with a '181' key and looking lost in thought.
Undergoes physical transformation at hair salon and nail salon, suggesting effort towards self-care and renewal.
Physically walks calmly through town, showing ability to keep composure amid unsettling events.
Notices the key similar to '181' and hides her amazement, showing controlled observation and discretion.
Decides to follow up on her observation by going to the sauna herself and inquires about the place, showing initiative and investigative skill.
Asks relevant and pointed questions to the receptionist, indicating confidence and clear understanding of her goal.
Quickly pays the price and proceeds downstairs to explore further, displaying decisiveness.
Politely asks the sauna employee where the locker is.
Maintains composure despite searching an empty locker and feeling defeated.
Forces a man out of a taxi aggressively but then softens her tone and thanks him politely.
Stands stiff and silent when confronted and verbally harassed by others at the cemetery.
Successfully finds and uses the correct locker key despite initially entering the wrong sauna area, showing perseverance and attention to detail.
Runs through the streets and forcefully gets a man out of a taxi in an emergency, demonstrating decisiveness and confidence.
Stands her ground stiffly in front of Bruno and others, refusing to move despite verbal confrontation, showing emotional strength but limited practical conflict resolution.
Impulsively jumps on car roof and violently jumps up and down on it to get her dog back.
Throws the dog’s keys back inside the car to Bruno after struggle.
Respectfully asks a cleaning lady about Orlando’s ceremony and whereabouts.
Follows Orlando quietly without confrontation into the underground cinerary level.
Tries to push Orlando away in terrified silence
